replies.body: The bugs regarding some units sitting stationary and idle for extended periods of time during combat are frustrating.
I love Aatrox cuz he's a Daddy but holy fk he loves to stand still for no reason and lose me rounds for no reason. Same for Zed...
I think {{champion:102}} getting rooted in-place while transforming is potentially the worst.

I think if you position properly they don't stand still. They will if they don't have access to any target because they are body blocked. I.e. 6 assassin comps or comps with a lot of melees in general.
positioning does not fix it ive seen it multiple times where ill have one champion on the filed and hes chillin there doin nothing and hes not rooted or stunned or anything.. hes just standing there
Exactly, its not a bug its just no clear tile pathing is available to that melle attack champion.

there have been times in my games when i have one champ left and the enemy had one champ left and they both just stood there. i understand that if there is no path there is no path, but there are also bugs.

That is not a bug, that happens when the enemy placement does not allow melle to get into attack range. 

If the enemy back themselves into a corner with good tile placement and your front line consist of 2-3 big melle champs, if they cannot walk up and get into combat they just dont move, they will move again and start attacking once a clear path for them to attack opens up.

Figured people realized this, its a counterplay strat vs someone going heavy  melle and no ranged.

you are correct about the pathing, I use this to my advantage a lot.  but when you have a varus and an enemy tristana who are the only 2 champs left on the field stand there and do nothing until time that is NOT a pathing issue.

I think its still an issue, Ive had my melees freeze because there was no path originally for a short time, but when a path does open up and melee is still frozen. I think that's the situation hes talking about. Its when that path opens up, and they are still frozen, but I think that has to do with who the AI is targetting, for example if the AI is targetting a completely surrounded unit, then it should be able to retarget to a new one that isn't, but a lot of times that doesn't happen, so they kinda just sit there and die.
Looking forward to the changes. Something I have seen is that if you wait/play till the end, the screen gets stuck at "skip waiting for stats".  This is a fix I would like to see.
Logged in to upvote.

Can we please just get rid of Cursed Blade though? Or just completely redo what it does. Reducing a units star level is absolutely ridiculous at almost any percentage. What the item does to units goes against everything the game is built around. Hush is another item that is kind of in the same category, but just needs to have either a way lower proc chance or reduce it's silence to 1.5 seconds(since it has a 50% chance to proc). There are of course some other things that still need balancing like maybe something with Glacials, and I feel like there will be a problem with true dmg voids, but for now I feel that the majority has already weighed in on how terrible of an item Cursed Blade is.

I think it would be better if it only reduced the damage output of the target for a few seconds instead of lowering their star level until the end of the round.

Currently it is such a good offensive item because of the health drop when going to lower star levels, though considering its recipe it should be more defensive.
Shapeshifter 6? Isn't there only 5 shapeshifters right now? {{champion:60}} {{champion:150}} {{champion:76}} {{champion:102}} {{champion:50}} . Guess we are getting a 6th shapeshifter next.

Same thing with gunslingers ({{champion:18}} {{champion:104}} {{champion:41}} {{champion:236}} {{champion:21}} ) and brawlers ({{champion:19}} {{champion:421}} {{champion:53}} {{champion:31}} {{champion:106}} ).  It is probably for an upcomming feature (they have stated they want to add champions from a new origin) though why implement it now?
Probably just a way of teasing the new characters.  Get people to speculate who's going to be added.
Maybe they will add a spatula combo for these origins?

{{champion:254}} Piltover, Brawler. {{champion:51}} Piltover, Gunslinger possibly {{champion:141}} as Demon, Shapeshifter or {{champion:77}} as Wild, Shapeshifter. If they do add Piltover as the next origin that could also add {{champion:61}} and {{champion:74}} as Sorcerers giving {{champion:61}} her ult to bring some serious CC to sorc or they could make her more a support and allow her to shield multiple allies with her E I could see {{champion:74}} being similar to say venomancer from AC and placing turrets, possibly placing some passively like GP Barrels and then once he hits max mana turns one of his turrets into the Ult version I'm not 100% sure what they would do with {{champion:126}} {{champion:164}} and {{champion:81}} they could even go as far to make an Inventor class for {{champion:74}} and {{champion:126}}. it is possible they would make {{champion:164}} a Robot even though she isn't exactly a robot I could see it. I don't know if they'd add in {{champion:222}} as a Pilty or reserve her for Zaun if/when they add in champs like {{champion:154}} {{champion:112}} {{champion:245}} {{champion:36}} etc.
Piltovians would be interesting! Gunslingers Caitlyn and Jinx + Brawler Vi? And maybe some kind of faction buff on that I think would be nifty.

Udyr would be the most obvious candidate for shapeshifter with Kayn being the #2 as for gunslingers Jhin and Caitlyn are probably the most probable imo as for brawlers you have a stupid large amount of the cast to choose from lol.

I think they left a piece out of their patch notes.

Gunslingers:

We really like the fact that we can play the game without using our brains and hyper re-rolling gunslingers, so we aren't changing cursed blade even though its fairly unanimous in the community that this item needs reworked or removed in its current state.

Can the way income is earned be adjusted to be more consistent? Currently win streak is given out before interest, but loss streak is give out at the same time as your other income.  Also the pings from losing a fight can delay pirate gold pickup time and make you lose money.  Lastly, why do some pirate gold incomes happen immediately after the fight but others wait to spawn the chest until you return from Battle?  Please just make all these things work one way so we can better plan our games!
you get pirate money immediately when the fight takes place in your arena. you get it afterwards when you teleport back to your arena from an opponents

If I am not mistaken, only the 1 gold for winning a PvP fight is gained before interest (actually as soon as the battle is over), not the win streak gold which is gained along the interest gold.

But yeah, the pirate gold gain needs to be more consistent as it can impacts interest gold when you fight on your arena but not when you fight on someone else's arena.
You get 1 gold before interest every PvP battle you win. It's intended to work that way. You get the win/loss streak with interest gold
There aren't 9 Blademasters in the game, Only 6. got kinda confused when I saw that, then I realized it was a typo
Probably not, as the Imperials trait does not apply to items
If true, then at least we can indirectly scale it from stat modifiers: Herald, Wild Synergy, Sorcerer Synergy, Rageblade, etc.
I'm so excited for all these adjustments. This is really gonna shake the meta. Knights look sick early. I feel like Yas is going to be so strong. Early Braum feels amazing with all that armor.

so u nerf demons (thank god) but not the stupidly annoying being stunned for the whole fight glacials? An on top of it u buff some of them.....sej gets a stun buff are u kidding shes glacial ffs less stuns plz or put a gd diminish on the dam thing or lower the chance do something to them ffs don't buff them..

I haven't seen a full glacial team win. Demons are prevalent every game: you think gunslingers are strong because they beat everything? Nah, they dominate early and mid game bc they're one of the few comps that can operate while being mana burned.
ive won so many times with full glacials and just building around voli. its stupid how much you can just make essentially the entire enemy team stand still
Hell, Trist excels and does MORE dps when mana burned
Nerf demon buff slightly, mega buff demons. Now Aatrox can 1-shot your team even easier!
Aatrox was nerfed

Some interesting changes. Definitely makes me want to check stuff out again.

Still think Demon should get a rework so it isn't so binary. Getting a lucky mana burn when someone is at near max mana is very big compared to getting mana burn any other time. Feels like either it is a huge swing or useless.

Also, would love it if there was an anti-CC item. Something like Merc Treads or Banshee's Veil as a counter to CC heavy builds like Glacial or Sej/Cho/Morg/Kennen.
I want to use the skins I bought to dress up my little champions.
they didnt have true damage before its for the void change
What about Vayne? {{champion:67}}
It's not just the round after selling the unit. Frozen Heart flat out doesn't activate in around 60% of fights even if nothing changes in 10 fights.
Oh yay, another update to this DOTA auto chess competitor. Because riot cares a lot more about TFT than normal rift...
the rift game has an update to you noob
Don't mind him he's a Pepega
Is it a bug that in an assasin vs assasin match, one comp doesn't jump? I have this trouble few days ago and was trash that my assasins stayed moveless :/

That's because assassins are invisible at the beginning of a round. If you played against an assassin comp that was 100% assassin there is no one to target so they don't move. Same thing happens when you go against the wolves and you play all assassins - no one moves.
